name: CachedMessageQueue
desc:
Message queue that caches received messages in memory to allow peek operations
that may not be supported by the undelying queue.

name: CachedMessageQueue
desc: Creates a new instance of the persistence component.

name: clear
desc: Clears component state.

name: close
desc: Closes component and frees used resources.

name: configure
desc: Configures component by passing configuration parameters.

name: endListen
desc:
Ends listening for incoming messages.
When this method is call listen unblocks the thread and execution continues.

name: listen
desc: Listens for incoming messages and blocks the current thread until queue is closed.

name: open
desc: Opens the component.

name: peek
desc:
Peeks a single incoming message from the queue without removing it.
If there are no messages available in the queue it returns null.

name: peekBatch
desc:
Peeks multiple incoming messages from the queue without removing them.
If there are no messages available in the queue it returns an empty list.

name: readMessageCount
desc: Reads the current number of messages in the queue to be delivered.

name: receive
desc: Receives an incoming message and removes it from the queue.

name: sendMessageToReceiver
desc: Sends a message to a receiver.

name: subscribe
desc: Subscribes to the message broker.

name: unsubscribe
desc: Unsubscribes from the message broker.

name: CallbackMessageReceiver
desc: Wraps message callback into IMessageReceiver

name: CallbackMessageReceiver
desc: Creates an instance of the CallbackMessageReceiver.

name: receiveMessage
desc: Receives incoming message from the queue.

name: DefaultMessagingFactory
desc:
Creates MemoryMessageQueue components by their descriptors.
Name of created message queue is taken from its descriptor.

name: DefaultMessagingFactory
desc: Create a new instance of the factory.

name: IMessageQueue
desc: Interface for asynchronous message queues.

name: abandon
desc:
Returnes message into the queue and makes it available for all subscribers to receive it again.
This method is usually used to return a message which could not be processed at the moment
to repeat the attempt. Messages that cause unrecoverable errors shall be removed permanently
or/and send to dead letter queue.

name: beginListen
desc: Listens for incoming messages without blocking the current thread.

name: complete
desc:
Permanently removes a message from the queue.
This method is usually used to remove the message after successful processing.

name: endListen
desc:
Ends listening for incoming messages.
When this method is call listen unblocks the thread and execution continues.

name: getCapabilities
desc: Gets the queue capabilities

name: getName
desc: Gets the queue name

name: listen
desc: Listens for incoming messages and blocks the current thread until queue is closed.

name: moveToDeadLetter
desc: Permanently removes a message from the queue and sends it to dead letter queue.

name: peek
desc:
Peeks a single incoming message from the queue without removing it.
If there are no messages available in the queue it returns null.

name: peekBatch
desc:
Peeks multiple incoming messages from the queue without removing them.
If there are no messages available in the queue it returns an empty list.

name: readMessageCount
desc: Reads the current number of messages in the queue to be delivered.

name: receive
desc: Receives an incoming message and removes it from the queue.

name: renewLock
desc:
Renews a lock on a message that makes it invisible from other receivers in the queue.
This method is usually used to extend the message processing time.

name: send
desc: Sends a message into the queue.

name: sendAsObject
desc:
Sends an object into the queue.
Before sending the object is converted into JSON string and wrapped in a MessageEnvelope.

name: IMessageQueueConnection
desc: Defines an interface for message queue connections

name: createQueue
desc:
Creates a message queue.
If connection doesn't support this function it exists without error.

name: deleteQueue
desc:
Deletes a message queue.
If connection doesn't support this function it exists without error.

name: readQueueNames
desc:
Reads a list of registered queue names.
If connection doesn't support this function returnes an empty list.
–öeturns a list with registered queue names.

name: IMessageQueueFactory
desc: Creates message queue componens.

name: createQueue
desc: Creates a message queue component and assigns its name.

name: IMessageReceiver
desc: Callback interface to receive incoming messages.

name: receiveMessage
desc: Receives incoming message from the queue.

name: LockedMessage
desc:
Data object used to store and lock incoming messages
in MemoryMessageQueue.

name: expirationTime
desc:
The expiration time for the message lock.
If it is null then the message is not locked.

name: message
desc: The incoming message.

name: timeout
desc: The lock timeout in milliseconds.

name: MemoryMessageQueue
desc: Message queue that sends and receives messages within the same process by using shared memory.

name: MemoryMessageQueue
desc: Creates a new instance of the message queue.

Returnes message into the queue and makes it available for all subscribers to receive it again.
This method is usually used to return a message which could not be processed at the moment
to repeat the attempt. Messages that cause unrecoverable errors shall be removed permanently
or/and send to dead letter queue.

desc: Opens the component with given connection and credential parameters.

name: MemoryMessageQueueFactory
desc:
Creates MemoryMessageQueue components by their descriptors.
Name of created message queue is taken from its descriptor.

name: MemoryMessageQueueFactory
desc: Create a new instance of the factory.

name: createQueue
desc: Creates a message queue component and assigns its name.

name: MessageEnvelope
desc:
Allows adding additional information to messages. A trace id, message id, and a message type
are added to the data being sent/received. Additionally, a MessageEnvelope can reference a lock token.

name: MessageEnvelope
desc:
Creates a new MessageEnvelope, which adds a trace id, message id, and a type to the
data being sent/received.

name: fromJSON
desc:
Converts a JSON string into a MessageEnvelop
The message payload is passed as string

name: fromJson
desc:
Converts a JSON string into a MessageEnvelop
The message payload is passed as string

name: getMessageAsJson
desc:
Returns the value that was stored in this message
as a JSON string.

name: getMessageAsString
desc: Returns the information stored in this message as a UTF-8 encoded string.

name: getReference
desc: Returns the lock token that this MessageEnvelope references.

name: setMessageAsJson
desc: Stores the given value as a JSON string.

name: setMessageAsString
desc: Stores the given string.

name: setReference
desc: Sets a lock token reference for this MessageEnvelope.

name: toJSON
desc:
Converts this MessageEnvelop to a JSON string.
The message payload is passed as string
Returns A JSON encoded representation is this object.

name: toString
desc: Convert's this MessageEnvelope to a string, using the following format:

name: MessageQueue
desc: Abstract message queue that is used as a basis for specific message queue implementations.

name: MessageQueueFactory
desc:
Creates IMessageQueue components by their descriptors.
Name of created message queue is taken from its descriptor.

name: configure
desc: Configures component by passing configuration parameters.

name: createQueue
desc: Creates a message queue component and assigns its name.

name: setReferences
desc: Sets references to dependent components.

name: MessagingCapabilities
desc:
Data object that contains supported capabilities of a message queue.
If certain capability is not supported a queue will throw NotImplemented exception.

name: MessagingCapabilities
desc: Creates a new instance of the capabilities object.

name: canAbandon
desc: Informs if the queue is able to abandon messages.

name: canClear
desc: Informs if the queue can be cleared.

name: canDeadLetter
desc: Informs if the queue is able to send messages to dead letter queue.

name: canMessageCount
desc: Informs if the queue is able to read number of messages.

name: canPeek
desc: Informs if the queue is able to peek messages.

name: canPeekBatch
desc: Informs if the queue is able to peek multiple messages in one batch.

name: canReceive
desc: Informs if the queue is able to receive messages.

name: canRenewLock
desc: Informs if the queue is able to renew message lock.

name: canSend
desc: Informs if the queue is able to send messages.

name: clear
desc: Clears component state.

name: messageCount
desc: Gets the received message count.

name: messages
desc: Gets the list of received messages.

name: receiveMessage
desc: Receives incoming message from the queue.
